articles.title: Researcher calls for new UN ocean agency to tackle global sustainability crisis
articles.description: A Keele University academic has called for the creation of a United Nations Ocean Agency to coordinate global action on the ocean and drive progress on climate, biodiversity, and pollution—the "triple planetary crisis" threatening life on Earth.
articles.content: A Keele University academic has called for the creation of a United Nations Ocean Agency to coordinate global action on the ocean and drive progress on climate, biodiversity, and pollution—the "triple planetary crisis" threatening life on Earth.

articles.title: Radiocarbon analysis of turfgrasses can help cities measure greenhouse gas emissions
articles.description: Cities around the world are working to limit emissions of climate-warming greenhouse gases, but there have been few ways of measuring whether those gases are actually decreasing in any given municipality. In new research, University of California, Irvine scientists have created an effective method to measure greenhouse gas emissions around cities—something that can help local governments gauge the effectiveness of their emission-curbing programs.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: Cities around the world are working to limit emissions of climate-warming greenhouse gases, but there have been few ways of measuring whether those gases are actually decreasing in any given municipality. In new research, University of California, Irvine scientists have created an effective method to measure greenhouse gas emissions around cities—something that can help local governments gauge the effectiveness of their emission-curbing programs.

articles.title: Mechanochemical technique achieves 99.98% nitrous oxide removal at just 42°C
articles.description: A research team affiliated with UNIST has developed a novel technology capable of nearly 100% decomposition of nitrous oxide (N₂O) at ambient temperatures. This innovative solution uses mechanical impacts and friction to create a highly energy-efficient way to manage nitrous oxide emissions from engine exhaust and chemical processes, making a significant contribution to greenhouse gas reduction and carbon neutrality efforts.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: A research team affiliated with UNIST has developed a novel technology capable of nearly 100% decomposition of nitrous oxide (N₂O) at ambient temperatures. This innovative solution uses mechanical impacts and friction to create a highly energy-efficient way to manage nitrous oxide emissions from engine exhaust and chemical processes, making a significant contribution to greenhouse gas reduction and carbon neutrality efforts.

articles.title: Nationals abandon net zero
articles.description: The National Party have abandoned their target for net zero carbon emissions by 2050 setting up a climate and energy showdown at the next election.

articles.title: ‘We’re not going to streak ahead’: Nationals officially dump net zero climate target
articles.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud said his MPs had come to a unanimous position, and would instead aim to bring down Australia’s carbon emissions in line with the rest of the world.

articles.title: Pets contribute to greenhouse gases like us. Here’s how to reduce their carbon pawprint
articles.description: "What else do pets do? We have to feed them. I think that that's why it's number one," said Allison Reser, director of sustainability and innovation at the Pet Sustainability Coalition.
articles.content: "What else do pets do? We have to feed them. I think that that's why it's number one," said Allison Reser, director of sustainability and innovation at the Pet Sustainability Coalition.

articles.title: World on track to dangerous warming as emissions hit record high: UN
articles.description: National commitments to slash heat-trapping pollution would limit global warming up to 2.5C this century—nowhere near enough to avoid devastating climate impacts despite a sweep of new pledges, the UN warned Tuesday.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: National commitments to slash heat-trapping pollution would limit global warming up to 2.5C this century—nowhere near enough to avoid devastating climate impacts despite a sweep of new pledges, the UN warned Tuesday.

As the United States steps back from climate leadership, the world's attention has turned to China—the largest emitter of greenhouse gases and a growing powerhouse in clean energy technology.

articles.title: Plant microbial fuel cells can generate electricity and reduce greenhouse gas emissions in soils
articles.description: Microbial fuel cell (MFC) technology has received considerable attention in the field of wastewater treatment over the past decade. This technology can simultaneously generate electricity and treat wastewater by cultivating electrochemically active microorganisms. However, recent discoveries have shown that MFC systems can be combined with soil to form soil microbial fuel cells (SMFCs), or further combined with plants to form plant microbial fuel cells (PMFCs).
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: Microbial fuel cell (MFC) technology has received considerable attention in the field of wastewater treatment over the past decade. This technology can simultaneously generate electricity and treat wastewater by cultivating electrochemically active microorganisms. However, recent discoveries have shown that MFC systems can be combined with soil to form soil microbial fuel cells (SMFCs), or further combined with plants to form plant microbial fuel cells (PMFCs).

articles.title: Study uncovers role of hydroxyl radical in greenhouse gas production during soil drying–rewetting
articles.description: In a new study published in Global Change Biology, Prof. Zhang Yuanming's team from the Xinjiang Institute of Ecology and Geography of the Chinese Academy of Sciences has unveiled a previously underestimated factor in greenhouse gas emissions from arid environments: hydroxyl radicals, often dubbed "free radicals."
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology

articles.title: Earth observation from space: New satellites to deliver precise emission maps
articles.description: As of 2027, new satellites for CO2 measurement (CO2M) will be launched into orbit. Originally, only two were planned—but simulations by Empa convinced the European Commission to have a third satellite built. This will significantly improve coverage on a global scale: instead of every five days, the greenhouse gases carbon dioxide (CO2) and methane (CH4) can now be measured around the globe every 3.5 days.
articles.content: As of 2027, new satellites for CO2 measurement (CO2M) will be launched into orbit. Originally, only two were planned—but simulations by Empa convinced the European Commission to have a third satellite built. This will significantly improve coverage on a global scale: instead of every five days, the greenhouse gases carbon dioxide (CO2) and methane (CH4) can now be measured around the globe every 3.5 days.

articles.title: Bacteria reveal hidden powers of electricity transfer
articles.description: Microbes are masters of survival, evolving ingenious strategies to capture energy from their surroundings. For decades, scientists believed that only a handful of bacteria used specialized molecular "circuits" to shuttle electrons outside their cells—a process known as extracellular electron transfer (EET). This mechanism is critical for cycling carbon, sulfur, nitrogen, and metals in nature, and it underpins applications ranging from wastewater treatment to bioenergy and bioelectronics materials.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: Microbes are masters of survival, evolving ingenious strategies to capture energy from their surroundings. For decades, scientists believed that only a handful of bacteria used specialized molecular "circuits" to shuttle electrons outside their cells—a process known as extracellular electron transfer (EET). This mechanism is critical for cycling carbon, sulfur, nitrogen, and metals in nature, and it underpins applications ranging from wastewater treatment to bioenergy and bioelectronics materials.

articles.title: Conflict and the climate crisis may mean it's time to rethink what we mean by responsible investing
articles.description: Sustainable or responsible investing has experienced huge growth over the past decade. This investment approach is anchored in environmental, social and governance principles and is known as ESG. This set of standards is designed to ensure that funds are directed toward companies that protect the environment, have a positive impact on people through things such as labor standards, and operate ethically, transparently and with accountability.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: Sustainable or responsible investing has experienced huge growth over the past decade. This investment approach is anchored in environmental, social and governance principles and is known as ESG. This set of standards is designed to ensure that funds are directed toward companies that protect the environment, have a positive impact on people through things such as labor standards, and operate ethically, transparently and with accountability.

articles.title: Bamboo tissue paper may not be as eco-friendly as you think
articles.description: Bamboo tissue paper, often marketed as an eco-friendly alternative, may not be as green as consumers think. Researchers at NC State University found that while bamboo fibers themselves are not more polluting than wood, China’s coal-dependent energy grid results in a higher carbon footprint for bamboo-based products compared to North American wood tissue. The study emphasizes that manufacturing technology and energy sources play a greater role in sustainability than the choice of fiber.
articles.content: Bamboo tissue paper, often marketed as an eco-friendly alternative, may not be as green as consumers think. Researchers at NC State University found that while bamboo fibers themselves are not more polluting than wood, China’s coal-dependent energy grid results in a higher carbon footprint for bamboo-based products compared to North American wood tissue. The study emphasizes that manufacturing technology and energy sources play a greater role in sustainability than the choice of fiber.

articles.title: Amazon Launches Rivian Electric Delivery Vans in Canada
articles.description: Amazon has launched its first Rivian electric delivery vans in Canada, deploying 50 custom-built vehicles in Vancouver to advance its net-zero emissions goal by 2040 and deploy 100,000 globally by 2030. This follows U.S. success and addresses sustainability needs. The move promises reduced emissions and sets precedents for international expansion.
articles.content: Amazon has launched its first Rivian electric delivery vans in Canada, deploying 50 custom-built vehicles in Vancouver to advance its net-zero emissions goal by 2040 and deploy 100,000 globally by 2030. This follows U.S. success and addresses sustainability needs. The move promises reduced emissions and sets precedents for international expansion.

articles.title: Public can comment on how state should handle pollution from Asheboro wastewater plant
articles.description: The EPA is holding a public hearing Wednesday in Asheboro on toxic chemical leaks from the city's wastewater plant that flow into the Cape Fear River, a drinking water source for more than 1 million North Carolinians.
articles.content: The EPA is holding a public hearing Wednesday in Asheboro on toxic chemical leaks from the city's wastewater plant that flow into the Cape Fear River, a drinking water source for more than 1 million North Carolinians.

articles.title: Nickel nanowires in plasma-treated nanotubes boost hydrogen production from urea
articles.description: Skoltech researchers have created a promising catalyst to speed up a chemical reaction producing clean hydrogen fuel from the urea contained in wastewater. While that process is known to be catalyzed by various forms of nickel, the team has now shown nanowires of that metal embedded in purposely defective carbon nanotubes treated by nitrogen plasma to be particularly fit for withstanding the aggressive alkaline environment of the reaction.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: Skoltech researchers have created a promising catalyst to speed up a chemical reaction producing clean hydrogen fuel from the urea contained in wastewater. While that process is known to be catalyzed by various forms of nickel, the team has now shown nanowires of that metal embedded in purposely defective carbon nanotubes treated by nitrogen plasma to be particularly fit for withstanding the aggressive alkaline environment of the reaction.

articles.title: Historical records help uncover climate impacts and future trends of hailstorms in China
articles.description: A research team led by Professor Zhang Qinghong and Li Rumeng from the Department of Atmospheric and Oceanic Sciences at Peking University (PKU) School of Physics, has found that hailstorms in China have surged since the Industrial Revolution, likely due to human-driven climate warming. The study, published in Nature Communications in September 2025, combines historical records, meteorological data, and artificial intelligence to track long-term hailstorm trends.
articles.source: Phys.org - News And Articles On Science And Technology
articles.content: A research team led by Professor Zhang Qinghong and Li Rumeng from the Department of Atmospheric and Oceanic Sciences at Peking University (PKU) School of Physics, has found that hailstorms in China have surged since the Industrial Revolution, likely due to human-driven climate warming. The study, published in Nature Communications in September 2025, combines historical records, meteorological data, and artificial intelligence to track long-term hailstorm trends.
